title: Quiz of the week: What did Lady Gaga not win at the VMAs?
description: How closely have you been paying attention to what's been going on during the past seven days?

title: Alexei Navalny: Two hours that saved Russian opposition leader's life
description: Germany has revealed he was poisoned with Novichok. This is how events unfolded over Siberia.

title: Reeta Chakrabarti: My Forgotten Army family ties
description: The news presenter discovers more about her father-in-law, just one of the men who belonged to the 14th Army in Burma.

title: Migrant crisis: Rescue boat baby five years on
description: One of a million migrants who came to Europe in 2015, Stephanie was heavily pregnant when she was saved.

title: Belarus: The great-grandmother taking on President Alexander Lukashenko
description: As street protests in Belarus continue well into their fourth week, a 73-year-old has turned into an unlikely hero for demonstrators.

title: Beirut aftermath: The blast that was felt around the world
description: The emotional impact of the city's deadly port explosion has been felt as far away as Ethiopia and Syria.

title: Ferguson and Kenosha: How two presidents responded to civil unrest
description: Two cities, two police shootings, two very different presidents. We take a look at their responses.

title: Profile: Former Australian PM Tony Abbott
description: The former Australian prime minister is being lined up to help the UK negotiate post-Brexit trade deals.

title: Hair salon told it 'cannot advertise for a happy stylist'
description: The hair salon was told a job ad for a "happy" stylist would "discriminate against unhappy people".

title: Shark researchers size up real 'Megalodon' for first time
description: A study reveals true scale of the prehistoric mega-shark made famous in Jason Statham's The Meg.

title: When does the stamp duty holiday end?
description: The government has announced changes to stamp duty to help cut costs for anyone buying a home.

title: Brexit: End tariffs on UK-made ice cream vans - Liz Truss
description: The government calls the vehicles a "great British export" and vows to fight for them in trade talks.

title: Your pictures on the theme of 'my summer'
description: A selection of pictures from our readers on the theme of "my summer".

title: Coronavirus: Eight test positive for Covid-19 on flight from Crete
description: The eight teenage boys from Hampshire were on board a Wizz Air flight to Luton last week.

title: Premier League terminates £564m China TV rights deal
description: The Premier League terminates its contract with its licensee in China - its most lucrative overseas television rights territory - with immediate effect.

title: Williams family leaving Williams - founder and deputy team principal to step down
description: Founder Sir Frank Williams and deputy team principal Claire Williams are stepping down from Williams Racing after this weekend's Italian Grand Prix.

title: Amazon to create 7,000 UK jobs
description: The online retail giant is recruiting at more than 50 sites in response to growing customer demand.

title: Tony Abbott: Ministers defend ex-Australian PM over Brexit trade role
description: The former Australian prime minister has had talks about working for the UK government.

title: Costa Coffee warns up to 1,650 jobs are at risk
description: The coffee chain says there are still "high levels of uncertainty" as to when trade will recover.

title: Coronavirus: People sent long distances for Covid tests
description: Public health experts warn a lack of tests in some areas could mean new outbreaks are missed.

title: Coronavirus: Britons in Portugal await UK quarantine decision
description: Holidaymakers describe an anxious wait as ministers meet to discuss imposing restrictions.

title: Former spinner Rafiq claims 'institutional racism' at Yorkshire
description: Ex-Yorkshire spinner Azeem Rafiq says that "institutional racism" at the club left him close to taking his own life.

title: Star Trek to welcome transgender character
description: The sci-fi franchise is also set to introduce a non-binary character, producers say.

title: Teacher Simon Flynn died in paddleboard 'freak accident'
description: Simon Flynn fell into the water and got caught in moorings while on holiday in Cornwall.

title: Discrimination reports in English football rose 42% in 2019-20 - Kick It Out
description: Reports of discrimination in English professional football rose 42% last season despite fans not attending some games, says Kick It Out.

title: US election: Trump tells North Carolina voters to vote twice
description: The president says voters should test the system - despite it being illegal to vote more than once.

title: Coronavirus: 'Add upset stomach in children to symptoms'
description: Researchers say it may be worth adding diarrhoea and vomiting to the list of symptoms.

title: Portland: How a 'hyper-liberal' city's racist past is resurfacing
description: Portland has a reputation for being a liberal utopia. Black activists wants to puncture that image.

title: Llanelli teen earns up to £5k selling insects as pets each month
description: Cameron Reardon has a collection including tarantulas, stick insects, beetles and scorpions.

title: Foden realising 'every kid's dream' with England
description: Manchester City midfielder Phil Foden says he will be realising the dream "of every kid on the estate" if he makes his England debut this week.

title: Top seed Pliskova beaten in second round by France's Garcia
description: Top seed Karolina Pliskova is knocked out of the US Open in the second round with a heavy defeat by France's Caroline Garcia.

title: Sleepless: What is it like going back to the theatre?
description: Sleepless is the first indoor theatre show with a full cast to launch since the coronavirus outbreak.

title: Back to school: Four virus claims that parents should ignore
description: Children will be weighed to check lockdown obesity and other misleading online claims debunked.
